solari_mandate_of_light_ch1.name: Shadows in the Sacred Throne
solari_mandate_of_light_ch1.description: Crimson Order sympathizers have been identified within the ranks of the Solari Imperial. The Theology Council demands an immediate and discreet investigation before the corruption spreads further.
solari_mandate_of_light_ch1.briefing: Starhelm, I will be direct with you. We have intercepted coded transmissions originating from within our own fleet staging area in Sarum Prime. The cipher matches known Crimson Order communication protocols. Someone in the 7th Imperial Squadron is feeding intelligence to Omir Sarikusa's fanatics. I need you to eliminate the Crimson Order forward scouts operating near our patrol routes and recover their communication logs. The honor of the Empire depends on your discretion.

solari_mandate_of_light_ch2.name: The Traitor Among Us
solari_mandate_of_light_ch2.description: The recovered communication logs have revealed a high-ranking naval officer secretly coordinating Crimson Order ambushes on Imperial convoys. The traitor must be exposed and the Crimson Order staging base destroyed.
solari_mandate_of_light_ch2.briefing: The logs you recovered have been decrypted. The traitor is Captain Vorkan Arzad of the 7th Squadron — a decorated officer with three decades of service. It seems the Crimson Order turned him years ago with promises of forbidden rituals. He has been directing an entire Crimson Order strike wing from a hidden deadspace pocket in Arzad. I need you to assault that base, destroy their fleet, and capture Captain Arzad alive. He will face the Theology Council's judgment, not a quick death in the void.

solari_mandate_of_light_ch3.name: Divine Reckoning
solari_mandate_of_light_ch3.description: Captain Arzad's interrogation has revealed the Crimson Order are preparing a massive ritual sacrifice using captured Solari citizens. Their covenant fleet, led by a Crimson Order Solarius-class carrier, must be annihilated before the ritual is completed.
solari_mandate_of_light_ch3.briefing: Starhelm, the situation is far worse than we feared. Arzad confessed that his betrayal was only one thread in a much larger web. The Crimson Order have gathered a covenant fleet in the Bleak Lands, and they hold over two hundred Solari faithful in their cargo bays — intended as blood sacrifices in a dark ritual to their profane god. A Crimson Order Solarius leads the fleet. You must destroy the covenant fleet, eliminate the Solarius, and rescue the hostages before the ritual concludes. The Empress herself has sanctioned this operation. Go with God's wrath, starhelm. This ends now.

veyren_edge_of_frost_ch1.name: Unbalanced Books
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch1.description: Lai Dai Corporation has detected irregular financial flows between a Veyren Fleet procurement office and a shell company linked to the Iron Corsairs Pirates. The State Protectorate suspects corporate espionage at the highest level.
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch1.briefing: I appreciate your discretion in accepting this contract, starhelm. Lai Dai's forensic accountants flagged a series of payments routed through an Echelon Entertainment subsidiary — a known Iron Corsairs front. The payments originate from a Veyren Fleet procurement office in Nourvukaiken. We believe a Iron Corsairs operative is embedded within the station's supply chain, siphoning advanced weapon prototypes. Your first task is to intercept a Iron Corsairs smuggling convoy before it reaches the Venal border and recover whatever prototypes they are carrying.

veyren_edge_of_frost_ch2.name: The Rabbit Hole
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch2.description: The recovered prototypes contained embedded tracking firmware. Analysis reveals the Iron Corsairs are building a prototype electronic warfare platform that could blind the entire Veyren Fleet sensor network. Their research facility must be located and neutralized.
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch2.briefing: The prototypes you recovered were not mere weapons — they contained classified sensor algorithms from the Veyren Fleet's AEGIS network. If the Iron Corsairs reverse-engineer this technology, they could develop countermeasures that render our entire fleet detection grid useless. Our intelligence assets have traced the research to a hidden Iron Corsairs laboratory in a deadspace pocket near Taisy. The facility is heavily guarded by Fatal Rabbit elite squadrons. Destroy the research facility, eliminate the escort fleet, and recover the AEGIS algorithm data cores before they can be transmitted to Venal.

veyren_edge_of_frost_ch3.name: Fatal Overreach
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch3.description: The Iron Corsairs have activated their electronic warfare platform aboard a modified Wyvern-class supercarrier. If it goes online, the entire Veyren border defense network goes dark. This is a final, decisive strike against Fatal Rabbit's most ambitious operation.
veyren_edge_of_frost_ch3.briefing: Starhelm, we are out of time. The Iron Corsairs have installed the completed jamming platform aboard the Huntsman's Wyvern — Fatal Rabbit's flagship. Our deep-cover agent reports they plan to activate it within hours, creating a sensor blackout across the entire Lonetrek-Black Rise corridor. Every Iron Corsairs raiding fleet in Venal is standing by to exploit the gap. The State Protectorate has authorized unrestricted engagement. You will lead the assault on the Wyvern's escort fleet and disable the jamming platform. The Veyren Fleet will handle the supercarrier once its defenses are down. The fate of the State's border security rests on this operation.

aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch1.name: Bitter Harvest
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch1.description: A new strain of the Venom Syndicate-manufactured combat booster 'Crash' is flooding the streets of Aurendis and Oursulaert. Federation Customs suspects the Venom Syndicate have established a new production network dangerously close to high-security space.
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch1.briefing: Starhelm, we have a crisis on our hands. Federation hospitals are reporting a surge of overdose cases from a new variant of Crash — the Venom Syndicate combat booster. This strain is more potent and far more addictive than anything we have seen before. Worse, it is reaching civilian populations, not just starhelms. Federation Customs traced a distribution chain to a Venom Syndicate stash site in Algintal. I need you to hit that site, destroy the drug stockpiles, and eliminate the Venom Syndicate distributors. We need to stem the flow before more citizens die.

aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch2.name: Serpent's Garden
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch2.description: The distribution records reveal a massive Venom Syndicate production laboratory hidden in Syndicate region space, operating under the protection of a corrupt Senate aide. The lab must be destroyed before the next shipment leaves.
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch2.briefing: The records you recovered paint a grim picture. The Venom Syndicate have built an industrial-scale laboratory in a deadspace pocket near MHC-R3, producing enough refined Crash to supply the entire Federation. But here is the twist that keeps me up at night — the logistics are being coordinated by someone in Senator Brecourt's office. A Senate aide named Vesren Moliere has been providing clearance codes that allow Venom Syndicate transports to pass through Federation customs checkpoints unchallenged. We cannot move on Moliere yet without evidence, but we can shut down his supply. Destroy the production lab and its escort fleet, and recover the lab's production manifests. Those records will be the chain we use to drag Moliere before a tribunal.

aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch3.name: Broken Jaktfalkn
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch3.description: Salvador Sarpati himself has dispatched a Venom Syndicate Corporation capital fleet to silence the witnesses and destroy the evidence. The Aurelian Grand is mobilizing for a direct confrontation, and they need a starhelm spearhead.
aurelian_accord_of_liberty_ch3.briefing: Starhelm, Sarpati is furious. The loss of his laboratory and the exposure of his Senate contact has cost him billions and threatened his entire Federation distribution network. Our intelligence reports that he has dispatched a Venom Syndicate capital task force — led by a Vindicator-class flagship — to intercept and destroy the evidence convoy transporting Moliere and the production manifests to the Federal Supreme Court. The Aurelian Grand is scrambling a response fleet, but they will not arrive in time. You must defend the evidence convoy, destroy the Venom Syndicate task force, and eliminate the flagship. If that convoy is destroyed, Moliere walks free and the Venom Syndicate rebuild within months. Everything we have fought for comes down to this.

keldari_ashstorm_ch1.name: Smoke on the Horizon
keldari_ashstorm_ch1.description: Keldari Tribal intelligence has detected unusual Shadow Pact activity near Keldari border systems. Large quantities of rare minerals used in advanced weapon manufacturing are being smuggled into Maledictus region. The Republic fears a new weapons program.
keldari_ashstorm_ch1.briefing: Starhelm, I will not waste your time with pleasantries. The Shadow Pact has been running heavy convoys through our border systems for weeks — convoys loaded with isodium-5 and nebuline compounds. Those are not materials you use for drug production or standard pirate armaments. Those are components for capital-class weapon systems. Our scouts tracked the latest convoy to a waypoint in Eystur before it jumped toward Maledictus. I need you to hit the next convoy, destroy the escorts, and seize the cargo manifests. We need to know what the Angels are building, and we need to know yesterday.

keldari_ashstorm_ch2.name: Forged in Fire
keldari_ashstorm_ch2.description: The cargo manifests reveal the Shadow Pact is constructing a devastating new superweapon — a directional doomsday device small enough to mount on a battleship hull. Their weapons foundry deep in Maledictus must be destroyed before the prototype is completed.
keldari_ashstorm_ch2.briefing: The manifests confirmed our worst fears. The Shadow Pact is not building conventional weapons — they are developing a miniaturized doomsday device, codenamed 'Ashstorm.' If they succeed, any Angel battleship could carry the destructive power of a titan's main gun. The foundry is located in a fortified deadspace complex in Utopia. It is defended by Pact Ascendant-class elite ships and automated defense batteries. I will not lie to you — this will be one of the hardest fights of your career. Destroy the foundry, eliminate the defense fleet, and recover the Ashstorm prototype schematics. If we fail here, the balance of power in the warzone shifts permanently in the Cartel's favor.

keldari_ashstorm_ch3.name: Ashes and Defiance
keldari_ashstorm_ch3.description: The Shadow Pact completed a second Ashstorm prototype in a backup facility and mounted it on a Duskwing-class flagship. They are moving to test-fire the weapon on a populated Keldari border colony. The Keldari Tribal is launching an emergency strike.
keldari_ashstorm_ch3.briefing: Starhelm, I have the worst possible news. The Angels had a second foundry — we did not know about it in time. They have completed a working Ashstorm prototype and mounted it on the Pact Ascendant flagship Duskwing, the 'Scorch Apostle.' Intelligence reports the Cartel plans to demonstrate the weapon's power by firing it on the Keldari mining colony at Audesder — six thousand souls, mostly freed slaves building new lives. The Keldari Tribal is scrambling everything we have, but the Scorch Apostle's escort fleet is massive. You will spearhead the assault. Destroy the escort fleet, disable the Duskwing before it can fire, and protect Audesder. Those people have already survived slavery. They will not die to pirate ambition. Not on my watch, and not on yours.
